Trade/Device Name(s): Great Basin Staph ID/R Blood Culture Panel
Portrait Staph ID/R Blood Culture Panel
Regulation Name(s): Multiplex Nucleic Acid Assay for Identification of Microorganisms and Resistance Markers from Positive Blood Cultures
Instrumentation for clinical multiplex test systems
Specimen Type(s): Blood culture specimen (from positive blood culture bottles)
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Automated hot-start enabled polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
Hybridization probes immobilized on silicon chip
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Great Basin Staph ID/R Blood Culture Panel, an automated multiplex PCR assay for rapid identification of Staphylococcus species and detection of mecA gene from positive blood cultures.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for qualitative, multiplex, nucleic acid-based identification of Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus lugdunensis, other Staphylococcus species (genus level), and mecA gene for methicillin resistance directly from positive blood culture specimens, to aid in the diagnosis of bacterial bloodstream infections.
